author: .vbuterin
content: Random meta-question: is "eth1x" still a useful channel or even a useful concept right now? It feels like the key constituent parts of it (verkle trees/statelessness, portal network, gas cost changes, state expiry, EVM upgrades) all have their separate channels and work streams now.

author: sky.cactus
content: #execution-client is a useful channel I think.

author: sky.cactus
content: I very much am against <#688075293562503241> though. As I have ranted about a ton (we need to kill the ETH1/ETH2 naming meme).

author: bridge-bot
content: <EvanVanNess> Even beyond that...1x was always an awful meme (re @eth1x_bridge_bot: <Micah> I very much am against #eth1x though. As I have ranted about a ton (we need to kill the ETH1/ETH2 naming meme).)

author: ajsutton
content:
Eth1.x was a  very important concept to get us to a point where Ethereum development (and more importantly deployment) happening in two parallel streams (eth1 and eth2) rather than essentially stagnating waiting for eth2 to deliver all the improvements. 
So Iâ€™d say itâ€™s actually one of the most powerful memes Iâ€™ve seen at least at the protocol level. I think itâ€™s now run itâ€™s course but we shouldnâ€™t underestimate how important it was in getting us to this point.

author: bridge-bot
content: <jhancock76> The original 1559 work came from an Eth1.x workshop where Alexey asked Rick Dudley at the end, "hey you want to tackle 1559?"

author: bridge-bot
content: <jhancock76> It does feel like a good time to retire it

author: bridge-bot
content: <jhancock76> Now we can just call them Ethereum Improvement Proposals

author: djrtwo
content:
+1 on historic reasons. Being able to discuss them separately was a boon to parallel work streams

I'm pro doing a general re-org on the discord

At least two high level categories for R&D with a watercooler channel for each and then category division for separate topics:
`pos-consensus`
`execution-layer`

This likely maps to eth1x and eth2 in most cases.

The only reason I'm hesitant to do so today is that *pre-merge* there are actually two full systems to discuss in parallel so calling it the "execution-layer" too early is a bit confusing because the "eth1" pow chain is actually an end-to-end consensus on it's own
